title: How to Write an Email Query Letter

steps.title: Email the correct editor.
steps.content: Email the correct editor. Take the time to find the exact email address you need to send your query to. [1] X Research source Ensure the editor you are contacting accepts email query letters. While it is becoming increasing more popular, some editors still prefer snail mail query letters. Make sure your email will be accepted before you send it. [2] X Research source

steps.title: Use an appropriate subject line.
steps.content: Use an appropriate subject line. To prevent your email from appearing to be spam, use the subject line "Query: Subject/Title". [3] X Research source

steps.title: Use a formal salutation.
steps.content: Use a formal salutation. Email is often perceived as more casual, but this is a business communication, so use a formal salutation.

steps.title: Present your idea.
steps.content: Present your idea. Use the same format and information as you would in a written query , however try to make it more concise. [4] X Research source If necessary include to include any attachments.

steps.title: Add a signature.
steps.content: Add a signature. Include your writing address and telephone number, as well as your email address. [5] X Research source

steps.title: Review your email before sending.
steps.content: Review your email before sending. Proofread, spellcheck, and read over your email. [6] X Research source Use proper grammar. Don't use net-speak. If you wrote your email in a word-processor and then copy-pasted it to email, check for characters that did not copy properly. Often word-processors use special characters that will appear as gibberish in email programs.
